content:
We're going to have support for async fn in traits, and we're planning on using that for the standard library versions of AsyncRead/AsyncBufRead/AsyncWrite.

Would it make sense to use that for AsyncIterator as well, and replace poll_next with async fn next?

After reading the content of https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org/pull/921/files:

The trait for async iteration in the standard library (Stream) has a different name and is not stabilized; its definition is likely to change, too, once we have strong support for async fns in traits.

I assume that's the goal.
@Charles Lew thanks for filing https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/93613 to change the names!
I also created a separate Zulip topic in wg-traits to discuss the language expressiveness issue of the non-"async fn in traits"-design.
